instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message: .. Did not <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> Looks bad OL on  diode mode and .674 volts with charger... I took off <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> and still have OL on the non grounded end of cap and on f6905

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message:
[SIZE=48px][B]You can't measure resistance when there is power in a circuit, that's how you blow a multimeter up. Read the sticky first: [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/5371-forum-rules"]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards...71-forum-rules[/URL][/B][/SIZE]

[SIZE=11px]Determine if <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present on <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>.[/SIZE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message:
[FONT=arial][SIZE=36px]WHY DID YOU ASSUME THAT I HAD CHARGER PLUGGED IN???? NOW YOU LOOK LIKE A JACK ASS!
Can i please get a real response.. <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> reads OL so does fuse.. on diode and when i have charger plugged in im getting .658 v[/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message: just saw the little bit of text under your huge remark.. no pp3v42 is not present....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Aldizi, post: 11347"]OL on diode mode and .674 volts with charger... [/QUOTE]

[QUOTE="Aldizi, post: 11438"][FONT=arial][SIZE=36px]on diode and when i have charger plugged in im getting .658 v[/SIZE][/FONT][/QUOTE]

Diode mode measurements are the same as measuring resistance. [B]You CANNOT have a charger plugged in when you are measuring a voltage drop!! STOP!!![/B]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message:
Are u sure your MM show you V? 
You should see something like Î© or K or M

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message: What it says is... on diode mode i get OL on <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> and when i check for voltage at that same point with charger plugged in i get .658v I typed really fast i thought you would understand since it was a voltage reading and not a resistance reading but i can see the misunderstanding... either way. The whole caps thing is out of line...  i know not to have charger plugged in when on diode mode thx!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message: Do you have 16v coming to the input of the circuit at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
threads.message: I put 5v on pp3v42 via psu and smc burned to a crisp i cannot replace smc... no setencil or time...close thread...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b No green.. NO PWR ON
